alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Northern Columbia; Southern Columbia; Suwannee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Columbia, central Suwannee and eastern Hamilton Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 415 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Luraville, or 8 miles southwest of Live Oak, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Live Oak, White Springs, Suwannee Springs, Wellborn, Belmont, Obrien, Mcalpin, Suwannee Valley and Houston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Hamilton; Northern Columbia; Southern Columbia; Suwannee
